definitions.definition: The practice or philosophy of being a skeptic .
A studied attitude of questioning and doubt .
The doctrine that absolute knowledge is not possible .
A methodology that starts from a neutral standpoint and aims to acquire certainty through scientific or logical observation.
Doubt or disbelief of religious doctrines .

main_definition: ( philosophy ) The practice or philosophy of being a skeptic .
secondary_definitions: ( philosophy ) A studied attitude of questioning and doubt .
( philosophy ) The doctrine that absolute knowledge is not possible .
A methodology that starts from a neutral standpoint and aims to acquire certainty through scientific or logical observation.
Doubt or disbelief of religious doctrines .
